macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: S&P 500 Rallies as Gold and Silver Hit Record Highs
items.summary: The S&P 500 advanced approximately 0.4-0.6% on Monday, December 22, 2025, during Christmas week trading. Gold and silver reached record highs amid the market movement.

items.title: S&P 500 Eyes Potential Breakout to 7,000 Despite Recent Volatility
items.summary: After a marginal weekly gain of 0.1%, the S&P 500 experienced four consecutive down days last week before recovering. Analysts suggest the index could still reach 7,000 in 2025, with large declines in volatility (VIX down 11.62% on Friday) indicating potential bullish momentum ahead.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Bitcoin Faces Worst Year Since 2018 with 22% Q4 Decline
items.summary: Bitcoin is down more than 22% in Q4 2025, heading for its worst year since 2018, while trading around $88,200 after a 0.7% drop in the past 24 hours. This pressures altcoins amid broader market fatigue.[2][4]

items.title: Ethereum and Bitcoin ETFs See $1.1 Billion Net Outflows
items.summary: Ethereum and Bitcoin spot ETFs recorded combined net outflows of $1.1 billion in the third week of December, with Ethereum ETFs losing $643.97 million. Ethereum slipped 1% to $2,993, below $3,000.[1]

items.title: Trump Token Drops 21% This Month as Altcoins Hit Lows
items.summary: Trump token fell over 21% this month to its lowest level, with multiple mid- and small-cap altcoins hitting fresh daily and weekly lows amid market pressure. Major cryptocurrencies edged lower overall.[2]

items.title: Kalshi Partners with BNB Chain for Prediction Markets Expansion
items.summary: Kalshi partnered with BNB Chain, enabling direct BNB and stablecoin deposits via BSC to integrate regulated prediction markets into Web3 and boost liquidity. This positions BNB Chain as a hub for high-frequency apps and RWAs in 2026.[1]

items.title: DWF Labs Completes First Physical Gold RWA Transaction
items.summary: DWF Labs executed its first 25kg physical gold transaction on blockchain, planning expansion to silver, platinum, and cotton to enhance liquidity and transparency in physical RWAs beyond T-bill tokenization.[1]

items.title: Polymesh Launches Confidential Assets on DevNet
items.summary: Polymesh DevNet introduced Confidential Assets feature, enabling privacy-preserving tokenized assets on-chain. XAUT hit record highs at $4,486 amid gold rally; UNI proposal to burn 100M tokens gains strong support.[1]

items.title: Crypto Market Deleveraging Seen as Positive Reset for 2026
items.summary: Market deleveraging in 2025, including negative ETF flows, is viewed as a healthy reset strengthening institutional foundations, with focus shifting to fundamentals, RWAs, AI, and sustainability in 2026.[3]

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: KAIST Develops AI System for Autonomous Injection Molding Optimization
items.summary: Researchers from KAIST have created generative AI technology that autonomously optimizes injection molding processes and an LLM-based knowledge transfer system called IM-Chat to address skilled worker shortages and multilingual manufacturing environments.

items.title: MIT Researchers Develop String-Actuated Deployable Structure Design Method
items.summary: MIT scientists have created a new optimization method for designing 3D structures that transform from flat configurations into complex curved forms with a single string pull, applicable to medical devices, foldable robots, and space habitats.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: Vince Zampella, Co-Creator of Call of Duty, Dies in Car Crash at Age 55
items.summary: Vince Zampella, pioneering video game developer behind Call of Duty and key figure at Respawn Entertainment and EA's Battlefield franchise, died in a Ferrari crash near Los Angeles. Electronic Arts described his influence on the industry as profound, with tributes from figures like Geoff Keighley highlighting his visionary leadership.

items.title: Vince Zampella, Call of Duty Pioneer, Dies at 55 After Car Crash
items.summary: The video game industry mourns Vince Zampella, co-creator of the Call of Duty series that has sold over 500 million copies, who passed away in a crash; he also led development on Star Wars Jedi games and revitalized Battlefield.

items.title: shroud Admits Liking Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 After Game Awards Backlash
items.summary: Streamer shroud, who urged fans to vote against Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 at The Game Awards, has now praised the game, echoing sentiments similar to those of Asmongold.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: Apple Releases iOS 18.4 and macOS 15.4 Betas
items.summary: Apple has made betas of iOS 18.4, macOS 15.4, and other platforms available to developers. This update comes alongside a new Australian law effective December 10 requiring social media platforms to block accounts for users under 16.

items.title: Alphabet Acquires Intersect for $4.75 Billion to Secure Clean Energy
items.summary: Google's parent company Alphabet acquired clean energy firm Intersect for $4.75 billion to support data center power needs, with Intersect's capacity expected to exceed 20 times that of the Hoover Dam by 2028. The company will operate independently to explore emerging energy technologies.

items.title: Erebor Bank Raises $350M for Crypto-Native Banking Infrastructure
items.summary: Erebor Bank secured $350 million in funding to develop crypto-native banking infrastructure. This is part of major startup funding rounds announced in the past day.

items.title: ZeroAvia Secures $150M Series D for Zero-Emission Flights
items.summary: ZeroAvia raised $150 million in Series D funding to advance zero-emission commercial flight technology. The funding supports development of hydrogen-electric propulsion systems.

items.title: Neurable Raises $35M for EEG Brain-Health Wearables
items.summary: Boston-based neurotech startup Neurable landed $35 million in Series A funding led by Spectrum Moonshot Fund for wearable EEG devices that monitor cognitive states in headphones and VR gear.
